intro: Spirostachys africana, commonly known as the African spurge, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in grassland and savanna habitats. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and usually have a hairy texture. The flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts.
